posts.post_content:
He's tailor-made for EDH, and it shows. He is very, very good but does not seem broken in the format, like Animar does. He was clearly designed as a build-around card, but the good part is that what you can build around him is not so well-defined. You can run the token-deck route, the +1/+1 counter route, the heavy sacrifice/death trigger route, and probably a few others. Let's start by listing cards he is ridiculous with:  
[Sigil Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil Captain): All the Saprolings you can pay for and subsequently huge creatures.  
[Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger): Al the Saprolings you can pay for, and no sacrificing before you get a huge creature  
[Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter): Decent since you can pay ![Variable Colorless](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=X&type=symbol) to kill something with toughness X or less, Vish himself gets huge for cheap, nuts with Juniper Order Ranger and/or Sigil Captain. Potentially -4/-4 for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) if you've got both.  
[Skullclamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skullclamp)/[Fecundity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fecundity): Hahahaha. Hahahaha! HAHAH... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
He's tailor-made for EDH, and it shows. He is very, very good but does not seem broken in the format, like Animar does. He was clearly designed as a build-around card, but the good part is that what you can build around him is not so well-defined. You can run the token-deck route, the +1/+1 counter route, the heavy sacrifice/death trigger route, and probably a few others. Let's start by listing cards he is ridiculous with:
Sigil Captain: All the Saprolings you can pay for and subsequently huge creatures.
Juniper Order Ranger: Al the Saprolings you can pay for, and no sacrificing before you get a huge creature
Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter: Decent since you can pay to kill something with toughness X or less, Vish himself gets huge for cheap, nuts with Juniper Order Ranger and/or Sigil Captain. Potentially -4/-4 for if you've got both.
Skullclamp/Fecundity: Hahahaha. Hahahaha! HAHAH... (see all)

posts.post_content: Out of all the Precon EDH general's, Ghave is by far my favorite. He's cheap, He boosts your creatures, and he gives you tokens. What's not to love? And because he's a big creepy looking guy, I decided to build around that theme. And what I got was an Infect EDH deck that Reanimates, Spawns, Kills, Life Gain, and literally sucks the life out of you as it grows in power. Just like a Diseased Fungus would do.

posts.post_content:
To all people who don't see why this is three colours, I think I've got it figured out:  
  
He's Green, White and Black.  
  
He comes into play with five +1/+1 counters. This makes him big and symbolises growth. Which is green.  
  
He can remove counters from some creatures to create others. Those creatures sacrifice personal strength to contribute to the community, or the greater good. Which is white.  
  
He can sacrifice creatures to add to the strength of others. Which is black.
posts.html:
To all people who don't see why this is three colours, I think I've got it figured out:

He's Green, White and Black.

He comes into play with five +1/+1 counters. This makes him big and symbolises growth. Which is green.

He can remove counters from some creatures to create others. Those creatures sacrifice personal strength to contribute to the community, or the greater good. Which is white.

He can sacrifice creatures to add to the strength of others. Which is black.

posts.post_content:
Oh my...the shenanigans that will come online with the release of Avacyn Restored! Check Cathars' Crusade and Champion of Lambolt.   
  
If you have Ghave, [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar) and those two out on the battlefield, you essentially have infinite, infinite/ infinite unblockable saproling tokens.   
  
Also, [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) will like Cathars' Crusade...a lot. So will [Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter).  
  
Ghave EDH just got crazy...again.

posts.post_content:
This guy just replaced [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari) as the general of my Saproling EDH deck. (Sorry, I refuse to call it Commander.) This allowed me to splash in white. All you naysayers seem to forget how EASY it is to get a stupid amount of +1/+1 counters on your creatures, [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) not withstanding. [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger) and the ultimate powerhouse, [Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra). The Hydra will start making more +1/+1 counters per turn than you are capable of using!  
  
Also, since I was able to add in [Rhys the Redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhys the Redeemed), the shenanigans have just gotten even worse. As long as you have a reliable untap ability, like [Patron of the Orochi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Patron of the Orochi) and [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse), Rhys can double your saprolings on EVERY PLAYER'S TURN. With [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger) in play, as well as an excellent mana source like [Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle), you can m... posts.post_content: Pretty much my favorite commander. Heres some tech i've been running with great success in our casual multiplayer games. INN and DA have brought many goodies for ghave. [Mentor of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mentor of the Meek), [Mikaeus, the Lunarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mikaeus, the Lunarch) and insane lands like [Gavony Township](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gavony Township), [Grim Backwoods](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Backwoods)and even [Vault of the Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault of the Archangel). [Rings of Brighthearth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rings of Brighthearth) works with ghave but is mostly so good with other stuff you want to run anyway like any Ajani, Elspeth or Garruk you can fit in. Also stuff like [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine) and those land abilities are pretty cool to copy.
posts.html:

Mentor of the Meek, Mikaeus, the Lunarch and insane lands like Gavony Township, Grim Backwoodsand even Vault of the Archangel. Rings of Brighthearth works with ghave but is mostly so good with other stuff you want to run anyway like any Ajani, Elspeth or Garruk you can fit in. Also stuff like Contagion Engine and those land abilities are pretty cool to copy.
